intro: Ricinocarpus boivinianus, commonly known as the African star gooseberry, is a small, deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces bright yellow, fleshy fruits that are edible when ripe, though the seeds contain toxic compounds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along riverbanks.
